Submodules¶

pydra.configuration module¶

pydra.pydra module¶

class pydra.pydra.Pydra(connections: dict, modules: Optional[list] = None, gui: bool = True, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pydra.core.base.PydraObject, PyQt5.QtCore.QObject

Main pydra class.

Parameters

  • connections (dict) – A pre-configured dictionary containing information about 0MQ ports to be used used by pydra objects in the network. Should be contained in the config file.

  • modules (list) – A list of modules to launch with pydra. Should be contained in the config file.

  • gui (bool (default=True)) – Whether to start the graphical user interface.

saver¶

Process containing the saver object.

Type

Saver

working_dir¶

Path to the working directory where data are saved.

Type

Path

filename¶

Basename for naming files.

Type

str

trigger¶
Type

Trigger

protocols¶
Type

dict

build_protocol(name, n_reps, interval, events)[source]¶

Builds a pre-existing protocol for running with the given repetitions and interval.

static configure(config, ports, manual=False)[source]¶
static decode_message(msg, msg_type)[source]¶

Decode INFO messages from saver.

end_protocol()[source]¶

Ends the current protocol if interrupted before completion.

exit(*args, **kwargs)¶

Called when the EXIT message type is received. May be re-implemented in subclasses.

freerunning_mode()[source]¶

Returns a free-running protocol.

name = 'pydra'¶
property pipelines¶

Returns a dictionary that maps pipeline names to a list of workers.

request_data()[source]¶

Request data from saver.

request_events()[source]¶

Request info from saver about worker events.

request_messages()[source]¶

Request messages from saver.

static run(gui=True, **config)[source]¶

Instantiates the pydra main class and starts the Qt event loop.

run_protocol()[source]¶

Runs the current protocol.

set_filename(filename)[source]¶

Sets the filename and broadcasts a set_filename event.

set_working_directory(directory)[source]¶

Sets the working directory and broadcasts a set_working_directory event.

shutdown()[source]¶

Ends and joins worker process for proper exiting.

startCmd()[source]¶

Start receiving command line inputs.

startUI()[source]¶

Starts up the user interface.

start_recording(*args, **kwargs)¶
stdin()[source]¶
stop_recording(*args, **kwargs)¶
test_connections(timeout=10.0)[source]¶

Checks that all workers in the network are receiving messages from pydra.

Parameters

timeout (float) – Maximum time to wait for workers to respond (seconds).

property worker_events¶

Returns a dictionary of events implemented by workers in the network.
